alert.note: Alert for McCook (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:03PM MDT until July 22 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MCCOOK COUNTY... At 503 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Salem, or 16 miles northwest of Lake Vermillion State Recreation Area, moving south at 20 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR SALEM. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central McCook County. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
